verses.kjv: And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh’s daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.
verses.ct: Solomon formed an alliance with Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, by marrying Pharaoh's daughter. He brought her to live in the city of David while he finished constructing his own palace, the temple of the LORD, and the wall surrounding Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Only the people sacrificed in high places, because there was no house built unto the name of the LORD, until those days.
verses.ct: At that time, the people were still offering sacrifices at hilltop shrines, because no temple had yet been built for the name of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Solomon loved the LORD, walking in the statutes of David his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in high places.
verses.ct: Solomon loved the LORD and followed the practices of his father David, except that he also offered sacrifices and burned incense at the hilltop shrines.

verses.kjv: And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place: a thousand burnt offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar.
verses.ct: The king traveled to Gibeon to offer sacrifices there, since it was the most important hilltop shrine. Solomon presented 1,000 burnt offerings on that altar.

verses.kjv: In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night: and God said, Ask what I shall give thee.
verses.ct: While at Gibeon, the LORD came to Solomon in a dream during the night. God said, "Ask me for whatever you want, and I will give it to you."

verses.kjv: And Solomon said, Thou hast shewed unto thy servant David my father great mercy, according as he walked before thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with thee; and thou hast kept for him this great kindness, that thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.
verses.ct: Solomon replied, "You showed tremendous mercy to your servant David, my father, because he lived in your presence with honesty, righteousness, and an upright heart. And you continued that great kindness by giving him a son to sit on his throne, as is the case today."

verses.kjv: And now, O LORD my God, thou hast made thy servant king instead of David my father: and I am but a little child: I know not how to go out or come in.
verses.ct: "Now, LORD my God, you have made your servant king in place of my father David. But I am like a young child — I don't even know how to carry out my responsibilities."

verses.kjv: And thy servant is in the midst of thy people which thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.
verses.ct: "Your servant is here among the people you have chosen — a vast nation, too numerous to count."

verses.kjv: Give therefore thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?
verses.ct: "So please give your servant a discerning mind to govern your people, so that I can tell the difference between right and wrong. For who could possibly govern such a great people on their own?"

verses.kjv: And the speech pleased the LORD, that Solomon had asked this thing.
verses.ct: The LORD was pleased that Solomon had made this request.

verses.kjv: And God said unto him, Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thine enemies; but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern judgment;
verses.ct: God said to him, "Because you asked for this — and did not ask for a long life for yourself, or for wealth, or for the death of your enemies, but instead asked for discernment to administer justice —

verses.kjv: Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.
verses.ct: I am granting your request. I have given you a wise and discerning mind, so that no one before you has been your equal, and no one after you will match you either.

verses.kjv: And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches, and honour: so that there shall not be any among the kings like unto thee all thy days.
verses.ct: On top of that, I am also giving you what you did not ask for — both wealth and honor — so that no other king will compare to you for as long as you live.

verses.kjv: And if thou wilt walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.
verses.ct: And if you follow my ways and obey my statutes and commands, just as your father David did, then I will also give you a long life."

verses.kjv: And Solomon awoke; and, behold, it was a dream. And he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and offered up burnt offerings, and offered peace offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.
verses.ct: Solomon woke up and realized it had been a dream. He went to Jerusalem and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, where he presented burnt offerings and peace offerings. Then he held a feast for all his officials.

verses.kjv: Then came there two women, that were harlots, unto the king, and stood before him.
verses.ct: Sometime later, 2 women who were prostitutes came and stood before the king.

verses.kjv: And the one woman said, O my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.
verses.ct: The first woman said, "My lord, this woman and I live in the same house. I gave birth to a baby while she was there with me.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the third day after that I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also: and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house.
verses.ct: 3 days after I gave birth, this woman also had her baby. We were alone together — no one else was in the house, just the 2 of us.

verses.kjv: And this woman’s child died in the night; because she overlaid it.
verses.ct: During the night, her baby died because she rolled over on it.

verses.kjv: And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thine handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.
verses.ct: So she got up in the middle of the night and took my son from beside me while I was sleeping. She placed him next to her and put her dead baby next to me.

verses.kjv: And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead: but when I had considered it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, which I did bear.
verses.ct: When I got up in the morning to nurse my child, I saw that it was dead. But when I looked more closely in the daylight, I realized it was not my son — it wasn't the baby I had given birth to."

verses.kjv: And the other woman said, Nay; but the living is my son, and the dead is thy son. And this said, No; but the dead is thy son, and the living is my son. Thus they spake before the king.
verses.ct: The other woman interrupted, "No! The living child is my son, and the dead one is yours!" But the first woman insisted, "No! The dead child is yours, and the living one is mine!" They argued like this in front of the king.

verses.kjv: Then said the king, The one saith, This is my son that liveth, and thy son is the dead: and the other saith, Nay; but thy son is the dead, and my son is the living.
verses.ct: The king said, "So one of you claims, 'My son is the one who is alive, and your son is the dead one,' while the other says, 'No, your son is the dead one, and my son is alive.'"

verses.kjv: And the king said, Bring me a sword. And they brought a sword before the king.
verses.ct: Then the king ordered, "Bring me a sword." So they brought a sword to the king.

verses.kjv: And the king said, Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.
verses.ct: The king commanded, "Cut the living baby in half, and give one half to each woman."

verses.kjv: Then spake the woman whose the living child was unto the king, for her bowels yearned upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it. But the other said, Let it be neither mine nor thine, but divide it.
verses.ct: At this, the woman who was the real mother cried out to the king, because her heart was breaking for her son. She pleaded, "Please, my lord, give her the living baby! Don't kill him!" But the other woman said, "He won't belong to either of us — go ahead and cut him in half."

verses.kjv: Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.
verses.ct: Then the king declared, "Give the living baby to the first woman. Do not kill him — she is his real mother."

verses.kjv: And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do judgment.
verses.ct: When all of Israel heard about the verdict the king had rendered, they stood in awe of him, because they could see that God's own wisdom was in him, enabling him to administer justice.
